creditline: Gift of funds from Nivin MacMillan
description: sketchy scene of city building facades; wavy lines; darkness at top and bottom of scene
inscription:
Signature and Inscription

on back, in pencil: [a10068] and [nw (?)]; see Signed
medium: Etching and drypoint printed in gray-brown ink
provenance: [Frederick Keppel & Co., New York (their stock no. in pencil on the verso a10068)]; Mrs. John D. Rockefeller (1839-1915); Mr. and Mrs. John D. Rockefeller III (1906-1978 and 1909-1992). Dr. and Mrs. James W. Nelson; [Linda Papaharis, New York]; Sam Josefowitz, Lausanne (1988-2014, sale, Christie’s, New York, April 23, 2014, no. 59; [C. G. Boerner, New York, and Harris Schrank Fine Prints, New York, 2014; sold to MIA]
signed: on tab at bottom edge of sheet: [(butterfly) imp.]
text: Nocturne: Palaces is among the most poetic of James McNeill Whistler’s Venetian creations. This print is an early proof of the image. Leaving a veil of ink on the surface of the copper printing plate and printing it on antique paper, Whistler produced magically luminous effects of light. This is a superb example of Whistler’s work at its most beautiful. Opportunities to obtain such a remarkable piece are extremely scarce, making this a jewel in the Mia’s collection.
title: Nocturne:  Palaces
